title: Most parts in A.P. likely to receive normal rainfall in July, says IMD
content: Thunderstorms, accompanied by lightning, are likely to occur in isolated places across Andhra Pradesh until July 7, suggests weather forecast

title: Polavaram irrigation project will be commissioned in 2027, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: The NDA government has attracted investment worth ₹9.5 lakh crore to the State in a year, with the potential to create 8.5 lakh jobs, says CM

title: Goa man throws acid on teenage boy to avenge his daughter's suicide; arrested
content: The accused told the police that he stole a five-litre acid can on Friday from the company in Goa where he was employed and hid it in his scooter

title: P.V.N. Madhav takes charge as BJP A.P. unit president, promises to strengthen NDA
content: Madhav vows to resolve internal differences among the alliance partners and secure a stronger role for the BJP within the government

title: YSRCP sympathiser was crushed under Jagan’s vehicle: Naidu
content: Videos gathered by the police during the investigation and forensic report have established that the elderly man was crushed under the vehicle of the YSRCP president, says the Chief Minister

title: When a mysterious tape recorder exploded severely injuring Tamil music director Shankar
content: The Chennai city police set up two special teams to crack the case.  All they had to proceed was a handwritten note that came with the parcel, containing instructions for activating the deadly device concealed inside what appeared to be a cassette player.

title: During Emergency, Tamil Nadu exceeded targets for male sterilisation under family planning programme
content: However, the State government did not furnish information on the number of cases of sterilisation of unmarried persons, persons having two or less children and persons more than 55 years of age.

title: Groundwater crisis deepens in Karnataka’s hard rock terrain
content: A new study suggests the primary cause of borewell abandonment is severe depletion of the water table rather than groundwater quality issues

title: Six held for exchanging bribes to give favourable report to medical colleges
content: The six accused were arrested when the bribe amount of ₹55 lakh was exchanging hands. The money was delivered in Bengaluru

title: 44 days on, Gulzar Houz fire probe panel awaits direction; another formed for Sangareddy blast
content: The committee was expected to investigate the incident, assess departmental lapses, and recommend safety measures

title: Pharma factory blast: Over 300 officials in race to trace six missing workers; Factories department suspect static charge and pressure build-up
content: Officials confirmed that 143 individuals were at the facility at the time of the explosion, of whom 74 were affected

title: Over 97,000 criminals convicted under ‘Operation Conviction’ since July 2023: U.P. government
content: ‘In a major success against the mafia, 29 out of 69 identified mafias were convicted, reaffirming that the crackdown is not limited to petty offenders,’ the U.P. government said in a statement

title: Digital copy of certified adoption orders valid, clarifies Central Adoption Resource Authority
content: Clarifying the term "certified copy," CARA said it refers to a digitally authenticated version bearing official attestation, and not a physical original or hard copy.

title: Shipwreck: PIL filed before Kerala HC seeking environmental security deposit
content: The vessel was carrying 643 containers, including 244 with hazardous and noxious substances, 58 with foreign waste, and over 450 metric tonnes of marine fuel.

title: Rains continue to batter Himachal; cloudbursts, flash floods create havoc
content: At least 17 people have died since June 20 in rain-related incidents, which include flash floods, drowning, and electrocution

title: Judiciary should not override executive’s decision to deport a foreign national: Home Ministry
content: The Ministry has appealed against a Jammu and Kashmir High Court order to repatriate a 62-year-old woman who was deported to Pakistan post Pahalgam terror attack

title: Tiruppur dowry death: Newly-wed husband, in-laws subjected Rithanya to cruelty, reveals police investigation
content: A. Rithanya, daughter of a real estate dealer from Kaikattipudur in Tiruppur, and E. Kavinkumar of Pazhangarai near Avinashi got married on over two months ago on April 11

title: Sanjeev Arora resigns from Rajya Sabha
content: Jagdeep Dhankhar accepted the resignation with immediate effect, “finding the same in conformity with Article 101 3(b) of the Constitution”

title: No cause for panic over heart attacks, say experts, as State-appointed panel begins probe over Hassan deaths
content: Public anxiety has led to a surge in outpatient visits at all the three units of Jayadeva - at Bengaluru, Mysuru and Kalaburgi

title: India asks Pakistan to verify nationality of 80 prisoners
content: The two sides exchanged lists of civilian prisoners and fishermen in each other’s custody through diplomatic channels

title: Opposition meeting with Election Commission over special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar deferred
content: Opposition parties led by the Congress have opposed the SIR saying it would lead to disenfranchisement of a large number of people in the State

title: NHAI holds review meet to assess preparations for Amarnath Yatra
content: The meeting was aimed at assessing the preparedness for the yatra set to begin on July 3 related to highway riding surface, lane markings, road safety measures as well as deployment of dedicated quick response teams

title: Bihar Cabinet clears internship, artist pension schemes; sanctions ₹882 crore for Punaura Dham
content: Monthly support for youth undertaking internships; cultural aid for senior artists; temple development on lines of Ayodhya Ram Mandir

title: Confusion reigns as Bihar’s Special Intensive Revision of rolls gets underway
content: Despite EC clarification about the need for proper documentary evidence only applying to 2.93 crore of the State’s 7.89 crore voters, a field visit to villages in Saran district shows apprehension and uncertainty about the exercise among voters

title: A more focused Quad will help deliver better, says Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister says India has “every right” to defend its people against terrorism and the partners of Quad grouping should “appreciate” that; he reiterates India’s commitment to rules-based international order and the “free and open Indo-Pacific”

title: Criminal laws biggest reform since Independence: Amit Shah
content: He said the laws impose strict timelines on the three key pillars responsible for delivering justice to citizens — the police, prosecution, and judiciary

title: India reserves right to deter cross-border terror attacks, Rajnath tells Hegseth, thanks U.S. for support
content: The two leaders had a 20-minute conversation during which Pete Hegseth invited Rajnath Singh to the U.S. for an in-person meeting to take the bilateral defence partnership forward

title: INS Udaygiri: Navy inducts indigenous stealth frigate in record time
content: Delivered in 37 months, remaining five P-17A frigates expected by 2026-end; they represent a “quantum leap” in the Navy’s in-house design capabilities at the Warship Design Bureau, says Ministry

title: Devanahalli: Landlords became farm labourers after losing their lands to projects
content: Devanahalli farmers are not willing to part with their lands for the proposed Aerospace Park at the cost of their livelihood

title: DSP accused in phone tapping case set to be demoted to inspector
content: The accelerated promotion of Praneeth Rao cropped up when the police officials probing the telephone tapping case began analysing different aspects of the case like why the prime accused and former police officer T. Prabhakar Rao specifically chose Mr. Rao and others to eavesdrop on the phones of others

title: Kolkata law college rape case: Accused sent to police custody till July 8
content: Kolkata Police said strict legal action would be taken against individuals attempting to disclose the identity of the survivor

title: RJD and its allies have anti-Constitutional mindset, says BJP
content: The BJP called RJD chief Lalu Prasad and his son Tejashwi Yadav as “faces of jungle raj” who are “determined to pursue communal politics”

title: Close on the heels of Bengaluru stampede, Karnataka police chief issues SOP for crowd management
content: State police chief says “modern gatherings are often spontaneous and influenced by social media, necessitating adaptive strategies,” prompting the SOP

title: Rajya Sabha MP Mahendra Bhatt re-elected Uttarakhand BJP chief
content: This time too, the BJP has chosen a Thakur as CM, and a Brahmin as the president of the State unit; the two communities constitute over half the voters in Uttarakhand

title: Trinamool urges Election Commission to use 2024 as base year for voter list revision
content: Party delegation flags birth certificate clause, voter data surge; seeks limits on booth access for central forces

title: Major revamp planned for Kukke Subrahmanya temple in Dakshina Kannada
content: Key projects include a new Ashlesha Bali Puja Mandira in Tulsi Garden and an Annadasoha Bhavan to serve 5,000 devotees daily.

title: Home Ministry appeals against J&K High Court order to repatriate woman deported to Pakistan
content: Petitioner’s daughter says the facts were distorted to push her mother out of India in the wake of the Pahalgam attack; Judge Rahul Bharti directs MHA to comply with order as it has not been stayed despite appeal

title: Karnataka monsoon: June sees 8% more rainfall; south interior districts register huge shortfall
content: Belagavi in the North-Interior Karnataka (NIK) meteorological subdivision received the most surplus rainfall with a 98% departure from normal

title: Bandstand in Lalbagh dismantled for restoration
content: The structure was set up by the British in the year 1870 and has since hosted many military and police bands, which played there

title: Surgeries resume in Thiruvananthapuram MCH’s Urology department
content: Surgical procedures at the Urology department had come to a standstill after the purchase process for the Lithoclast machine’s probe through the hospital development society had been inordinately delayed

title: Union Cabinet approves a four-lane highway section to facilitate easy access to Rameswaram
content: The Paramakudi-Ramanathapuram section will cost ₹1,853 crore. It will also connect key economic, social, and logistics nodes across southern Tamil Nadu, says the Union Ministry of Road Transport and Highways

title: From delivering food to delivering dialogues, the stages in the life of a woman theatre artiste from Kolkata
content: Sangita Sarkar, an alumna of the National School of Drama, is directing Moonlight, an adaptation of veteran Marathi playwright Mahesh Elkunchwar’s Sonata

title: NDA MPs walk out protesting Medha Patkar’s presence at meet of House panel on rural development
content: Officials from three Ministries and 10 civil society experts, including Ms. Patkar, attended the meet to review implementation of land acquisition law

title: We will ensure there are no issues in Gurukuls: Minister Adluri
content: ₹170 crore released towards diet charges, ₹100 crore towards payments and arrears of all staff in the various societies

title: Cabinet approves ₹1 lakh crore corpus for galvanising private investment in R&D
content: The funds would however be provided only for products that have reached a certain level of development and market potential

title: 'Reckless': What league insiders are saying about this stunning set of Bucks moves
content: Damian Lillard waived, Myles Turner to Milwaukee: Here's what the surprise moves mean for the Bucks, the Pacers and the NBA.

title: Gauff 'mentally overwhelmed,' falls at Wimbledon
content: Coco Gauff became just the third woman in the Open era to lose in the first round at Wimbledon right after winning the championship at the French Open, eliminated 7-6 (3), 6-1 by unseeded Dayana Yastremska of Ukraine on Tuesday night.

title: Sources: Pistons add Robinson in sign-and-trade
content: Free agent sharpshooter Duncan Robinson has agreed to a three-year, $48 million deal with the Detroit Pistons, sources told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: Penn to ban trans athletes, ending Thomas case
content: The University of Pennsylvania has agreed to ban transgender women from its women's sports teams to resolve a federal civil rights case.

title: Red Panda injured during Fever-Lynx halftime
content: Popular halftime performer Red Panda was injured at the start of her act at the WNBA's Commissioner's Cup game at Target Center on Tuesday.

title: Astros' Alvarez (hand) has setback; specialist next
content: Astros slugger Yordan Alvarez has experienced a setback in his recovery from a broken right hand and will see a specialist.

title: Springer's 7 RBIs help Jays pile on Yankees late
content: George Springer had a career-high seven RBIs, including his ninth grand slam, to help the Blue Jays beat the Yankees 12-5, drawing within one game of the AL East leaders.

title: Sources: Bucks waive Lillard, agree with Turner
content: The Bucks are waiving Damian Lillard and stretching the remaining $113M on his contract in order to acquire free agent center Myles Turner, sources told ESPN.

title: Fever's Cunningham pans WNBA expansion cities
content: Indiana Fever guard Sophie Cunningham took issue with two of the three expansion cities that will be joining the WNBA.

title: 💰Bobby Bonilla Day! Another $1.19M from Mets
content: Bobby Bo hasn't played for the Mets since 1999, but Tuesday he'll receive his annual hefty check from the team.

title: If Americans don't move in this transfer window, is the USMNT's 2026 World Cup doomed?
content: With the 2026 FIFA World Cup less than a year away, how important is it USMNT players transfer to better clubs or find clubs where they can play more?

title: USMNT’s grit, character are shining at Gold Cup and that will help at 2026 World Cup
content: This USMNT squad is learning so much about itself -- the biggest thing might be its grace under pressure.

title: Jalen Ramsey and Jonnu Smith for Minkah Fitzpatrick?!? We graded the Steelers-Dolphins blockbuster
content: Do Ramsey and Smith actually elevate Pittsburgh's roster? Did Miami maximize its return with Fitzpatrick? Let's size up the big trade.

title: Inside the MLB draft journey for the sons of two former major leaguers
content: They share a home state, have ex-MLB outfielders for dads -- and took two very different paths to the top of the draft.

title: A new kind of mock draft: Our insiders make the picks for all 30 teams -- with trades!
content: Blockbuster trades and high-risk picks. ESPN's experts team up for the mock draft you didn't know you needed.

title: NFL players are busy reading these authors, from Tolstoy to Belichick
content: A.J. Brown made reading cool after his viral moment on the bench in January. But what are other NFL players reading this summer?

title: Mbappe's Club World Cup debut was badly needed for Real Madrid, FIFA and the player himself
content: Kylian Mbappe's return for Real Madrid was badly needed: for him, for his team, and for the Club World Cup itself.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Aces, Valkyries, Mystics rise
content: The Aces have had an up-and-down season so far. Can they build on the momentum after defeating Phoenix?

title: What to know about expansion to Cleveland, Detroit and Philadelphia
content: Why is the WNBA expanding now? How will it impact the CBA and draft? What will more roster spots mean?

title: What's it like to defeat your former pro parent on the tennis court?
content: Shelton, Fritz, Ruud and several others at Wimbledon are kids of former pros. Was it a pivotal moment when they beat their parent? We found out.

title: Silva on City's CWC exit: 'No one wanted vacation'
content: Bernardo Silva has rejected the suggestion that Manchester City's early exit from the FIFA Club World Cup could be a blessing in disguise.

title: Toronto ends contracts of Insigne, Bernardeschi
content: Toronto FC have mutually agreed to terminate the contracts of former Italy internationals Lorenzo Insigne and Fernando Bernadeschi, the MLS club announced Tuesday.

title: USWNT's Yohannes nears Lyonnes move
content: United States women's national team midfielder Lily Yohannes is finalizing a move to French powerhouse OL Lyonnes, multiple sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Kepa joins Arsenal in $6.9M deal from Chelsea
content: Arsenal have completed a deal to sign goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga from Chelsea, the club has confirmed.

title: Report: Crew owner sells stake valued at $900m
content: Haslam Sports Group has sold a 10% stake in the Columbus Crew to the Edwards family at a franchise valuation of $900 million, Sportico reported Tuesday.

title: Ibrahimovic: 'Messi plays with statues' at Miami
content: Zlatan Ibrahimovic defended Lionel Messi following Inter Miami's elimination from the FIFA Club World Cup and likened the superstar's teammates to "statues."

title: Former Chelsea wonderkid Musonda retires at 28
content: Former Chelsea wonderkid Charly Musonda has retired from professional football at the age of just 28.

title: Fati signs new Barça deal, joins Monaco on loan
content: Barcelona forward Ansu Fati has joined Monaco on a season long loan ahead of the 2025-26 campaign, the Spanish club has confirmed.

title: Early Club World Cup exit gives Man City time to plan return to Premier League summit
content: Man City's Club World Cup stay was sweet, but all too short. The silver lining, though, is it gives the club time to recover from a disaster 2024-25.

title: The Mock Draft project: 2025's most wanted fantasy football picks
content: We put our experts through the paces of multiple mock drafts to derive the ultimate average draft positions for 2025.

title: What the trade to Steelers means for Jonnu Smith's value
content: Smith had a breakout year in Miami last season. Will he do it again after being traded to the Steelers?

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Is Jake Paul finally in the cruiserweight top 10?
content: Jake Paul took one more step toward challenging for his first world title. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: 'This is a startup': Meet the man in charge of policing the new world of college sports
content: Overseeing athlete payments in college sports may seem like a thankless, nearly impossible job. But Bryan Seeley thinks he's up to the task.

title: Married in Manhattan: Zach Wilson ties knot with Nicolette Dellanno in New York
content: Quarterback Zach Wilson got married over the weekend to Nicolette Dellanno a year after their engagement.

title: 2026 NFL mock draft: Miller's early projections for the first round, including four QBs
content: What might the Browns and Rams do with their first-rounders? How many QBs could go on Day 1? Here's Matt Miller's early look at the 2026 draft.

title: Bottas? Pérez? Which drivers could Cadillac sign ahead of 2026 F1 debut?
content: Eight months out from its F1 debut, Cadillac doesn't have a driver lineup yet. Who could we see in the American machines?

title: EA Sports reveals 'F1 The Movie' driver ratings in F1 25
content: Content based on the recent movie is now available in the game for those who've purchased the Iconic Edition.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Al Nassr tracking PSG's Fabián Ruiz
content: Paris Saint-Germain midfielder Fabián Ruiz is on the radar of Manchester United and Saudi Arabian side Al Nassr. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: CPI strongly opposes handing over Horsley Hills to Ramdev Baba
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in! health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The Hindu On Books Books of the week .

title: Trump announces Israel's agreement to 60-day ceasefire plan; urges Hamas to take deal
content: Donald Trump announced that Israel has agreed to the terms for a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, mediated by the US, Qatar, and Egypt. The proposed truce aims to halt the conflict that began after the October 7 attacks and allow for broader peace negotiations. Trump urged Hamas to accept the deal, warning of further deterioration.

title: 70% dip in Indians caught trying to enter US illegally in Jan-May 2025
content: Following Donald Trump's return as President and his strict immigration policies, the number of Indians caught illegally crossing into the US plummeted by 70% in the first five months of 2025. Despite the increased risks and disrupted smuggling networks, over 10,000 Indians still attempted the perilous journey, highlighting the enduring allure of the American dream.

title: 'Cops not bhagwan': CAT quashes IG's suspension for RCB stampede
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) has overturned the suspension of IPS officer Vikash Kumar Vikash, attributing the Chinnaswamy Stadium incident, which resulted in 11 deaths, to Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) invitation of a massive crowd without police consent.

title: Asia Cup: India vs Pak likely on Sept 7; tournament starts Sept 5 in UAE
content: The Asia Cup 2025 is tentatively scheduled to commence on September 5, culminating in the final on September 21. According to the initial schedule, India is poised to face off against Pakistan on September 7. With participating nations nearing government clearances, the tournament is likely to be held in the UAE.

title: 'Much less tariffs': Donald Trump hints at closing an India-US trade deal soon
content: President Trump announced that the US and India are nearing a trade agreement that would significantly reduce tariffs, creating a more level playing field for businesses. Negotiators are working to finalize the Bilateral Trade Agreement (BTA) before the July 9 deadline, despite India's firm stance on agricultural tariffs. External Affairs Minister Jaishankar remains optimistic about reaching a deal.

title: ChatGPT warning: OpenAI CEO asks users not to trust AI ‘much’
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users against over-reliance on ChatGPT, highlighting its tendency to 'hallucinate' and produce unreliable information. Despite ongoing advancements and new features, Altman acknowledges the technology's limitations and emphasizes the need for transparency. He also reversed his stance on AI hardware, suggesting that current computers are inadequate for an AI-driven world.

title: Wimbledon: 'Send her a kiss' - Alcaraz's reply to fainting fan's daughter wins hearts
content: During Wimbledon's hottest opening day ever, defending champion Carlos Alcaraz paused his match against Fabio Fognini to assist an elderly fan who was unwell due to the heat. Alcaraz alerted officials and provided water, later responding to the fan's daughter on social media with a message of concern and care, showcasing his compassion both on and off the court.

title: Toll touches 36, chem unit mgmt charged with attempted murder
content: A devastating explosion at Sigachi Industries' Telangana plant has claimed 36 lives, prompting a criminal investigation into the company's safety lapses. Negligence, including the absence of fire safety measures and warnings about faulty machinery, contributed to the tragedy. The Telangana government has announced substantial compensation for the victims and their families, as DNA profiling is underway to identify the deceased.

title: OpenAI is shutting down for the next week; CRO Mark Chen warns employees
content: OpenAI is temporarily closing down operations next week. This is to allow employees to rest after long work hours. Meta is trying to recruit OpenAI staff with high salary offers. Mark Chen warned OpenAI staff about Meta's tactics. Meta recently hired some OpenAI researchers. OpenAI is planning to change its compensation strategy.

title: 2nd T20I: Jemimah Rodrigues, Amanjot Kaur star in India's 24-run win vs England
content: Jemimah Rodrigues and Amanjot Kaur's explosive half-centuries propelled India to a 24-run victory over England in the second T20I, securing a 2-0 series lead. Their crucial 93-run partnership revived India after an early collapse, setting up a formidable total of 181. Despite Beaumont and Ecclestone's efforts, England fell short, with Shree Charani's impressive bowling further sealing India's win.

title: "‘Sh*t ton of money’: Travis Kelce on Tom Brady’s $375M FOX deal; playful jab sparks debate
content: Travis Kelce is preparing for his 13th NFL season. He is also considering a career in sports commentary after retirement. Kelce reacted to Tom Brady's huge commentator contract. He expressed interest in calling games. Kelce's podcast and media presence suggest a smooth transition. His business ventures are also expanding. Fans are curious about his future plans beyond football.

title: Bezos Venice wedding: Chamath flooded with gratitude; all sparked by one text
content: Venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya gifted Jeff Bezos a case of his ultra-premium tequila for his Venice wedding to Lauren Sánchez. Palihapitiya mentioned Bezos's last-minute request on X. The wedding, a lavish three-day affair reportedly costing $50 million, saw celebrity guests like Bill Gates and Kim Kardashian.

title: India-US trade deal: Talks enter 6th day as Trump deadline looms
content: India and the US are engaged in intense trade negotiations in Washington, aiming to finalize an interim trade agreement before the July 9th deadline, when reciprocal tariffs could be reinstated. India seeks improved market access for its workforce-intensive products, while the US desires duty reductions in agriculture and dairy.

title: 'Sitaare Zameen Par': Film maintains steady run; crosses Rs 130 crore mark
content: Aamir Khan's film 'Sitaare Zameen Par' continues its successful run. The movie has earned over Rs 130 crore in nearly two weeks. The film made around Rs 4 crore on its second Tuesday. Aamir Khan emphasized the importance of supporting diverse stories. 'Sitaare Zameen Par' features Aamir Khan as a basketball coach. The film also introduces ten new young actors.

title: CEC: Vote should be where you live, not ‘native’ place
content: Bihar is set to revise its electoral rolls. The goal is to stop people from voting in their hometowns while living elsewhere. Many migrants keep their votes in their native states. They travel back just to vote. The Election Commission wants people to vote where they live. This revision aims to fix this issue.

title: Ahead of state polls, cabinet approves Rs 1 lakh crore scheme aimed at creating 3.5 crore jobs
content: The Cabinet has approved the Rs 1-lakh crore Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) scheme to generate over 3.5 crore jobs in the organised sector. Announced in July 2024, the scheme aims to address concerns about job creation amid a rising number of job seekers. It targets first-time employees and encourages manufacturing companies to hire more, offering financial incentives to both.

title: No leadership change in Karnataka: Surjewala, DKS
content: Amidst internal discord within the Karnataka Congress, the central leadership has dismissed rumors of a change in leadership. Deputy CM DK Shivakumar affirmed that leadership transitions were not under discussion, emphasizing the importance of the 2028 elections. The party has warned against public statements that fuel speculation, prioritizing the strengthening of CM Siddaramaiah's government.

title: EC yet to hear from oppn after Congress plea for 'urgent' meet
content: Congress requested an urgent meeting with the Election Commission on behalf of 10 opposition parties to discuss Bihar's special intensive revision of rolls. The EC responded by inviting each party individually, but received no confirmation from any of them.

title: TMC minister terms Kolkata rape ‘a small incident’; BJP slams Mamata's ‘depraved regime’
content: The BJP has strongly criticized TMC after a state minister, Manas Bhuniya, seemingly downplayed the alleged gang rape of a law student in Kolkata. Bhuniya's remarks, where he referred to the incident as a 'small' one, sparked outrage. BJP leaders accused TMC of normalizing sexual violence. Bhuniya later clarified, condemning the incident and claiming his words were misrepresented.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Tribunal says police not 'Aladdin ka Chirag'; blames RCB for chaos
content: The Central Administrative Tribunal (CAT) has indicated Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) bears primary responsibility for a stampede that killed 11 people. RCB announced victory celebrations without securing necessary police clearance, leading to a massive, unmanaged crowd.

title: Kolkata gangrape case: Accused got inhaler for victim, then continued assault
content: Police investigated a gangrape at South Calcutta Law College. CCTV footage showed Zaib Ahmed buying an inhaler for the victim. Medical reports revealed struggle marks on Monojit Mishra. Monojit contacted Dr. Nayna Chatterji after the incident. Police questioned 16 individuals and arrested three men and a security guard. Evidence aligns with the victim’s complaint. The investigation is ongoing and sensitive.

title: Int'l students in line of fire again: Trump admin proposes limiting visa tenure to a fixed period
content: A proposed DHS rule, now under OMB review, seeks to replace 'duration of status' for international students with fixed stay periods, potentially requiring visa extensions. Experts fear increased delays, financial burdens, and uncertainty for students. With Indians comprising a significant portion of international students, the change could adversely affect them, impacting both students and the US education sector.

title: 'Big, Beautiful Bill': Moment when Trump learnt of 51–50 Senate win; ‘thank you, wow!’
content: Donald Trump received news of his tax bill's Senate passage during a Florida roundtable. The 'One Big Beautiful Bill Act' passed 51-50, with Vice President JD Vance breaking the tie. Three Republicans dissented over healthcare cuts and debt. The bill makes Trump's tax cuts permanent and introduces no taxes on tips. It includes Medicaid and food stamp cuts.

title: Layoff wave spreads across US: Starbucks, Frito-Lay, Microsoft may axe jobs
content: US companies are bracing for intensified layoffs this July, with nearly 95 employers planning job cuts across diverse sectors like tech, retail, and healthcare. Microsoft is expected to lay off between 1,000 and 2,500 workers. Factors driving these reductions include restructuring for profitability, Trump's tariffs, inflation, and weakening consumer demand.

title: India Playing XI tip-off: Nitish Reddy, Washington Sundar likely to play
content: India are likely to include all-rounders Nitish Kumar Reddy and Washington Sundar in the Edgbaston Test, potentially at the expense of a specialist batter. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hinted at Reddy's inclusion, while captain Shubman Gill emphasized the need for batting depth and the inclusion of two spinners given the dry conditions in Birmingham.

title: '20–30 bullets fired': Iskcon temple targeted in US; India urges action
content: The Indian Consulate in San Francisco has condemned recent shootings at the Iskcon Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple in Spanish Fork, Utah, urging swift action to bring the perpetrators to justice. The temple, known for its annual Holi Festival, suffered damage from 20 to 30 bullets fired over several days.

title: Infosys vs Cognizant fight! Why are the two IT firms battling it out? Explained
content: Infosys and Cognizant are embroiled in a fierce legal battle over alleged anti-competitive practices in the US healthcare IT sector. Infosys accuses Cognizant of undermining its Helix platform by recruiting key personnel, including former Helix leader Ravi Kumar S. Cognizant, in turn, claims Infosys misappropriated trade secrets related to its TriZetto software.

title: Olympian Vinesh Phogat, husband Somvir Rathee blessed with baby boy
content: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat and Somvir Rathee welcomed their first child, a baby boy. Harvinder Phogat confirmed the news, sharing the family's joy. Vinesh had announced her pregnancy earlier in March. She had faced disappointment at the Paris Olympics and later entered politics, winning the Julana seat.

title: IND vs ENG: Indian team asked to stay indoors in Birmingham after security alert
content: Ahead of the second Test against England in Birmingham, the Indian cricket team faced a security alert upon returning to their hotel after an optional practice session at Edgbaston Cricket Ground. The security unit instructed the team to stay indoors briefly, but normalcy was soon restored, allowing them to resume their activities.

title: Big jobs boost! Cabinet approves Rs 1.07 lakh cr scheme to create 3.5 cr jobs
content: The Union Cabinet has approved the Employment Linked Incentive (ELI) Scheme, allocating ₹99,446 crore to generate over 3.5 crore jobs within two years. New employees will receive wage incentives, while employers get support for creating additional jobs, especially in manufacturing.

title: 'One Big Beautiful Bill': Senate passes Trump’s spending bill; JD Vance breaks tie
content: The US Senate has approved President Trump's $4.5 trillion spending bill, extending tax cuts, increasing military spending, and funding border security. The legislation, expected to add $3.3 trillion to the national debt, now heads to the House amid Republican concerns. The bill faces opposition over healthcare cuts and spending levels, potentially impacting millions and sparking internal party divisions.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi heaves fire with bat; England yet level series
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi's steady 45 wasn't enough as India narrowly lost to England by one wicket in a thrilling second Youth ODI at Hove, levelling the series 1-1. Despite useful contributions from Vihaan Malhotra, Rahul Kumar, and others, England's Thomas Rew's explosive 131 shifted the momentum. Sebastian Morgan's late boundary secured the win for England in a nail-biting finish.

title: IND vs ENG: 'Earlier Kuldeep was kept out because of Ashwin' - Kaif warns India
content: India face England in the second Test at Edgbaston. Mohammad Kaif questions Kuldeep Yadav's continued exclusion. Team management is under pressure after the Leeds loss. They must decide between Sundar and Yadav for spin options. Bumrah may sit out due to workload. Thakur might be replaced by Reddy. Akash Deep could partner with Siraj.

title: What brought down AI 171 plane in Ahmedabad? Simulation puts focus on technical failure
content: Air India plane crash: Investigators are exploring potential simultaneous engine failures as the cause of the Air India Boeing 787 crash in Ahmedabad, which killed all but one onboard. Simulations suggest that landing gear and wing flap positions alone wouldn't have caused the crash.

title: IND vs ENG: Agarkar, Gambhir, Gill in intense discussion ahead of 2nd Test - Watch
content: Ahead of the crucial second Test, Indian captain Shubman Gill, coach Gautam Gambhir, and selector Ajit Agarkar intensely discussed team selection. They inspected the Edgbaston pitch, considering its impact on the playing XI. India contemplates changes, potentially resting Jasprit Bumrah. Assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate hinted at including two spinners.

title: 'In constructive custody': Mehul Choksi opposes ED’s fugitive tag; cites Belgium arrest
content: Mehul Choksi, accused in the PNB scam, contests being labeled a fugitive economic offender, citing his arrest in Belgium at India's request. His lawyer argues he's in 'constructive custody,' undermining the FEO Act's criteria. Simultaneously, Choksi faces recovery proceedings by SEBI for insider trading violations and pursues a UK case alleging abduction by Indian operatives.

title: 'Perpetrators Should Be Brought To Justice Without Delay': Quad Leaders On Pahalgam Attack
content: The foreign ministers of the countries also called on all the United Nations member states to cooperate in "bringing theperpetrators, organisers, and financiers of the reprehensible act to be brought to justice without any delay".

title: Quad Leaders Condemn Pahalgam Terror Attack, Seek Justice
content: A joint statement by the foreign ministers of the U.S., India, Japan and Australia condemned an April 22 terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam that killed 26 people, and urged that those behind it be brought to justice.

title: NASA's Anil Menon To Chosen For His 1st International Space Station Mission
content: NASA astronaut Anil Menon has been assigned his first mission to the International Space Station, serving as a flight engineer and Expedition 75 crew member, NASA said in its official statement.

title: Zohran Mamdani Confirmed As Democratic Candidate For New York Mayor
content: Rising star of the American left Zohran Mamdani is now officially the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, according to official results released Tuesday.

title: Trump Picks Daughter-In-Law Lara Trump For North Carolina Senate Seat
content: Donald Trump on Tuesday floated his daughter-in-law Lara Trump as a possible replacement for U.S. Senator Thom Tillis, who will not seek reelection in North Carolina after clashing with the U.S. president over his tax-cut and spending bill.

title: "India Has Right To Defend Against Terrorism": S Jaishankar At Quad Meet
content: India's External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio, Japan's Minister of Foreign Affairs Takeshi Iwaya, and Australia's Penny Wong attended the Quad Foreign Ministers' Meeting at the US Department of State on Tuesday.

title: Israel Has Agreed To Conditions To Finalise 60-Day Gaza Ceasefire: Trump
content: President Donald Trump said on Tuesday Israel had agreed "to the necessary conditions to finalize" a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza during which efforts will be made to end the U.S. ally's war in the Palestinian enclave.

title: Israel Army Says Intercepted Missile Launched From Yemen
content: Israel's military said it intercepted a missile launched from Yemen on Tuesday, while the Huthis claimed to have also attacked Israel with drones.

title: "Will Strengthen Indo-Pacific Stability": S Jaishankar At Quad Summit
content: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that the Quad ministerial meeting on Tuesday was very productive and will strengthen stability in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Multiple Shots Fired At ISKCON Temple In US, India Urges Swift Action
content: The ISKCON Sri Sri Radha Krishna Temple in Spanish Fork, Utah, renowned globally for hosting the annual Holi Festival, has come under attack in a suspected hate crime, with over two dozen bullets fired at the premises over several days.

title: "Perhaps Most Stringent In The Country": UIDAI Official On Manipur's Aadhaar Process
content: Manipur follows a process of issuing Aadhaar to adults that is considered the "most stringent" in the country, a senior official of the Unique Identification Authority of India (UIDAI) said at a meeting with Governor AK Bhalla.

title: India-US Trade Talks In Advanced Stage, Agricultural Products A Hurdle: Official
content: The India-US trade negotiations are at an advanced stage and a consensus on an interim deal is within reach, a key official told NDTV on Tuesday, adding that Washington's demands on agricultural products are proving to be a hurdle.

title: "Courage Has No Age": Woman Completes 10,000-Foot Skydive On 80th Birthday
content: Despite battling vertigo, cervical spondylitis and spinal disc issues, Dr Chauhan took the plunge after taking off from the Narnaul air strip in Haryana.

title: Food Licenses Display Must For Uttarakhand Eateries On Kanwar Yatra Route
content: The Uttarakhand government has made it mandatory for eataries on the Kanwar Yatra route in the state to prominently display their food licenses or registration certificates at their business establishments.

title: First Amarnath Yatra Batch To Leave Today Amid Tight Security
content: Amid tight security after the Pahalgam terror attack, the first batch of pilgrims for the annual Amarnath Yatra will leave from Jammu on Wednesday morning.

title: Two Chinese Nationals Arrested In US For Espionage
content: Two Chinese nationals have been arrested for espionage and for allegedly seeking to recruit members of the US Navy to serve as intelligence assets, the Justice Department said Tuesday.

title: Zohran Mamdani Officially Secures Nomination For New York City Mayor
content: The New York City Election board on Tuesday confirmed a stunning victory by mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani in the Democratic primary, clearing the way for the political upstart to be the party's nominee for the November mayoral election.

title: AAP's Sanjeev Arora Resigns From Rajya Sabha After Being Elected Ludhiana West MLA
content: AAP leader Sanjeev Arora resigned his Rajya Sabha membership after he won the assembly bypoll to Ludhiana West constituency in Punjab.

title: A Year Later, New Criminal Laws Fast-Track Justice, Reshape Digital Policing
content: A year since being implemented, Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, Bhartiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita and Bhartiya Sakshya Adhiniyam have already started reshaping how justice is delivered in the country.

title: X, India Spar Over Lawyer's 'Tom, Dick, And Harry' Remark For Government Officials
content: A lawyer for Elon Musk's X told an Indian court that every "Tom, Dick, and Harry" government official had been authorised to issue content takedown orders, drawing a sharp rebuke from New Delhi's counsel in the latest clash over content moderation.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Where does Topuria stand at lightweight? What about Makhachev?
content: Ilia Topuria beats Charles Oliveira via knockout in the first round . the lightweight division is in flux . there's a traffic jam at the top of the 155-pound rankings . it will be resolved once Jack Della Maddalena takes place at 170 pounds .

title: Midyear divisional grades: Kayla Harrison in an F-rated division?
content: the UFC has put on seven pay-per-view events and 15 Fight Night cards in eight U.S. states and seven international countries . we've seen six new champions crowned (one of whom didn't even have to fight for it), six title defenses and countless knockouts .

title: Who won and what questions remain after recruiting's busiest month
content: the most active month of the 2026 recruiting cycle is drawing to a close . Florida, Texas and Texas A&M led the charge among the nation's recruiting risers . Alabama, LSU and Ohio State stand among the prominent football powers poised to rise in July .

title: Los Angeles Lakers unveil Statement Edition uniforms for 2025-26 season
content: the lakers announced their new statement edition uniform for the 2025-26 season on monday . the uniform also used a purple base, instead of a gold font for the team name and dark color for the number . it will include the team's signature "LA" logo on both sides of the shorts for the first time on a core uniform .

title: NBA free agency 2025: Latest signings, news, buzz, live reports
content: Milwaukee's decision to acquire Myles Turner and waive Damian Lillard shakes up the Eastern Conference . the new york Knicks are still looking for a head coach, and the Boston Celtics are dramatically reshaping their roster . Desmond Bane is headed to Orlando in exchange for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope , Cole Anthony .

title: NHL free agency 2025: Signing grades for Granlund, Boeser, Gavrikov, more

title: NHL free agency tracker: A flurry of signings on July 1
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Big upsets: Gauff headlines record-breaking number of top-10 players eliminated

title: Transfer window: What do Europe's big clubs still need?
content: the transfer window has been a bit different this year thanks to the FIFA Club World Cup . but international deals will be officially going through in the premier league , german Bundesliga , French Ligue 1 , Spanish LaLiga and Italian Serie A on July 1 . we asked our ESPN reporters to assess the business still needing to happen .
